text: ‘La Poo Boo Moo..' Eye-line pencil; cherry-red lipstick; ‘Saks of Fifth Avenue’ COMPACT MIRROR, intricately engraved with “Love Bogie ‘In A Lonely Place’ 1950”; Elnett hair laquer; Chanel perfume. A larger BROKEN HAND-MIRROR. A GOLDEN LOVE HEART PENDANT (opens with a sychronised tune). All Gloria’s ‘tools’ procured from a TATTY GREEN WASH-BAG, a trusted witness to her ‘process’ probably a thousand times or more. GLORIA (0.C.) (CONT’D) ‘Major Mickey's Malt Makes Me Merry.’ Costume: Peek at pale flesh and slim limbs as she climbs into a black, pleated wrap around dress with a plunging neckline; black stockings and princess slippers.. the dress hangs loose, too loose.. the belt tightened as far as it can go.
Five minutes Miss Grahame.

Thanks honey. Gloria’s tongue CLUCKS the roof of her mouth in approval, it’s one of her things.  INT. DUKE’S PLAYHOUSE THEATRE/STAGE - LATER WE CLASP EYES on Gloria for the first time being AMANDA WIGFIELD in the ‘Glass Menagerie’. Owning the stage. Acting her guts out goddamit.

“That's why you act like this! I don't believe you go every night to the movies! Nobody goes to the movies night after night. Nobody in their right minds goes to the movies as often as you pretend to!” Gloria’s eyes blazing.
INT. DUKE’S PLAYHOUSE THEATRE — CONTINUOUS APPLAUSE from a small, enthusiastic AUDIENCE. Gloria takes her curtain call and theatrically welcomes her fellow ACTORS on stage. They hold hands and bow..

Curtain down, house lights on.. and over the speaker system the famous ditty ‘I'M JUST A GIRL WHO CAN'T SAY NO’ - sung by ‘Ado Annie’, Gloria’s character in ‘OKLAHOMA’. The gimmick that sends the audience merrily on their way.
INT. DUKE’S PLAYHOUSE THEATRE/STAGE - CONTINUOUS Gloria shimmying her shoulders as STAGEHANDS pack up.

(softly singing) “I'm just a fool when lights are low, I can't be prissy and quaint-- I ain't the type what can faint-- How can I be what I ain't? I can’t say no”.  INT. DUKE’S PLAYHOUSE THEATRE/DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT Gloria de-robing. The high wearing off, the beginning of a comedown she knows all too well. In the flesh she looks THIN. The wrong type of thin. SUDDENLY Gloria clutches her stomach; face contorted. WIDEN OUT as she collapses to the floor. EXT. ALLEYWAY/BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE - NIGHT PETER TURNER, 28, a strapping Scouser, walking home from ‘work’ down a rough Liverpool back alley. Note he has faint traces of THEATRE MAKE-UP that he’s not cleaned off properly... The alley leads onto a street full of red-bricked Victorian Terrace Houses. He stops outside NUMBER 8 the house where he grew up, strange he’s back, ‘nice strange’. Brother Joe’s FORD CAPRI parked on the path. He wanders in.. INT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE/KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS BELLA (70), Peter’s mum, cooks sausages for older brother JOE (40), his curvaceous wife JESSIE (38) sits playfully in his lap. JOE SNR (71), a man of greying countenance, is trailed by CANDY the mongrel dog as he scours the kitchen for the dog’s lead.
Y’might be staying in a luxury hotel Bella. Y’know three star and that, maybe more..
I don’t want to be staying in a bloody luxury hotel!
And be waited on hand and foot? Like the ‘Queen of Sheba’?
Joseph, my ‘Queen of Sheba’ days disappeared down the swanny the day I married your bloody father. 6
She scowls at Joe Snr, now even more desperate to escape. Suddenly Peter bowls in nearly knocking him over. They just give each other a canny look.
Seen the dog’s lead?
Not my department.
Desperate here lad.

(at Joe Snr) Sixteen years I’ve waited for this trip! You knew all about this stopover didn’t you? Y’big lump of lard! Forgot to tell me ‘till now. We’re supposed to be off next Tuesday. I would never have agreed if I’d known.
Sod this. Joe Snr disappears with the dog sans lead. Bella watches him bang the door on his way out.
What’s going on?
(notices) Y’mean apart from you wearing bloody eye-liner. Jesus wept. Joe seriously can’t believe it. Peter rushes to the sink and rubs it off.
Bloody actors, dressing up as birds, putting make-up on. Weird way to make a living for a bloke if you ask me.
No-one’s asking you ‘soft lad’. And I’m not playing a bird.. I’m playing ‘a nurse’ ina Allan Bleasdale play.
Can’t wait for this bloody ‘play’ thing to end so you can bugger off back to London. Where you belong.
Joseph! Enough.
Joe doesn’t mess with Bella. The lads flick ‘Vs’ like kids do, behind Bella’s back.
(to Bella) You look stressed, ma. What’s up?
I don’t want to talk about it.
Course she doesn’t.
Ma..?
Well.. I’ve just been reliably informed, by looking at the bloody tickets, that there’s a twenty four hour stopover in Manila when we fly back from Australia.
Manila, eh? Nice.
No Peter. Not nice. Not nice at all. (collects herself) I‘1ll have just said goodbye to your brother Billy... maybe the last time ever--
Don’t be daft.. Don’t say that!
No you two don’t be daft! I won't be going back all that way again, and our Billy won’t be coming back to Liverpool, ever.

BELLA (CONT’D) So, yes, it’s probably the last time I’1l1 see him before I leave this world. The last time, understand? pause) And I’1l be thinking about that, I know I will. And I don’t want be thinking about that on bloody 24 hour stopover in Manila! I don’t even know where the bloody place is!
Oh Ma come on. It’1l be fine. It’s just your first time on an airplane and that.
That’s what I said!
It’s a big deal. And not having seen our Billy for so long.
Sixteen bloody years...
You're bound to be a bit, y'know... edgy. The PHONE in the hallway rings out. Joe pats Jessie’s arse signalling for her to get up so he can answer.
C’mere. Peter goes gives his Mum a soothing hug.
God, I’ve missed him.
I know Ma. We all have. (pause) The selfish git. Bella playfully hits him.
You’re all bloody heartbreakers I tell you.
They don’t tell you that when your legs are laced-up in stirrups. Giving birth’s the easy bit. Joe comes back in - perturbed look.
(to Peter) Some director bloke, asking if you know Gloria Grahame. EVERYONE’S ears prick up on hearing THAT NAME.
Says she’s not well.. A WORRIED Peter jumps up; follows him to the phone.
Pete Turner speaking.
The Ford Capri firing its way towards Lancaster.
And that’s all he said? INT. FORD CAPRI —- CONTINUOUS 10 A bewildered Peter in the back seat - Joe drives, Jessie sits next to him. All are visibly worried.
That’s all he’d say on the phone, ‘extremely serious’. (frustrated) What the hell does that even mean? Why can’t directors just say how it is? (pause) She’s got form for stunts like this Gloria..
How'd y’mean?
She’s not scared to ‘cry wolf’. *  10 11 12
Well. Let’s hope she is then, eh? The car carries on in silence.
A knock on the door.
Gloria? Peter lets himself in, squints through the darkness. Gloria in bed... in the shadows.
(terse) Gloria?
Peter?
Oh, remember me then?
Peter. I’ve missed you so much.
(a flash of frustration) Course. That’s why you didn’t tell me you were in England?
Don’t be angry
Yeah well, it’s a bit of a shock to get a call saying you're sixty miles up the M6.. And now you’re ill I hear...? (pause) What’s going on Gloria?.. I can’t see properly. Peter moves towards her.

Don’t come so close honey. Sit on the other bed. Peter sits down, next to him an open SUITCASE with a few basic clothes; a bunch of PUBLICITY POSTCARDS of Gloria from her film ‘The Bad And the Beautiful’.. Peter’s seen this post-card before. He notes the sheet purposely covering her face.
It’s gas. I got gas in my stomach that’s all.

Let me see your face. Peter takes the risk, slowly pulls the sheet down. Gloria’s face - a waxy grey pallor, crusted make-up. Hair knotted to the roots. ON PETER’S ALARM Suddenly Gloria convulses in a fit of coughs. Peter helps her upright; puts a glass of water to her lips; she manages to take a few sips. The coughing fades..
Have you seen a Doctor?
No! No doctors. They got me like this in the first place.
This sounds bad, you need to see someone?
I wanna see your Mom. Take me to your home, Peter. Bella, she’1ll look after me. I can get better there. (beat) Take me to Liverpool... Peter more confused than ever--
You sure that’s a good idea? I mean you and me..
ee FH HF
It’s the only idea I got.
Light breaking of Liverpool. The Ford Capri drives past an art deco sky-scraper which wouldn’t look out of place on 5th Avenue. Gloria in Peter’s arms covered by a heavy blanket - looking out.
Liverpooool... INT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE/KITCHEN - DAWN 14 Bella and Joe Snr waiting, when Joe comes in with Jessie. They try to warn them with their looks.
Well?? How is the girl? Before he can reply Peter and Gloria appear. Bella’s eyes widen, Joe Snr slowly puts the paper down.
Hey Bella.. Hey Pops...
Gloria luv.. how are you?
I’m OK.. Or will be.
I said she could stay with us Ma. ‘Till she gets better.
Of course she can.
It won't be for long Bella, I promise.
Stay as long as you want my luv. We've really missed you.
Ma, she needs to go to bed straight away.  14 15 11.
Of course. Peter and Gloria head out into the hall.
You could have warned me. I’d have put the electric blanket on. Joe, Bella and Joe Snr left on the kitchen exchanging strange looks. They turn to Joe for an answer.
(grabs the suitcase) I best, er, take this up. He heads out to the stairs Jessie follows. Bella looks at Joe Snr... she also heads for the stairs.

A room stuck in the 50's; antique wardrobe; dressing table with wrap around mirror; wrought iron bed by a sash window. POPE JOHN PAUL II on the wall. Peter helps Gloria sit on the bed. Joe places the suitcase on an and old rocking chair.
(to Peter) Downstairs if you need me.
Thanks Joe.. Joe and Jessie look at Gloria then leave.. passing Bella on her way in.
It’s like a bloody igloo in here. She turns the radiator tap on.
Are you hungry luv? Can I get you anything? Gloria erupts coughing. Peter has to hold her tight. Bella taking in Gloria - her complexion, her frailty.  15 12.

It’s fine Ma. I’ll be down ina bit. Bella takes the hint, leaves. Gloria reaches into her green wash-bag (which she finds in her separate VANITY CASE), finds her BROKEN MIRROR; finds her reflection. Reflection shot: GINNY TREMAINE in ‘CROSSFIRE’. She puts the mirror down. They glance at each other awkwardly, air hanging heavy like a dulling wine. Peter opens her suitcase; finds her CREAM SILK PYJAMAS. Then his eyes drift over a MEDICAL DISCHARGE SHEET from Lancaster General Hospital. Finally he spots the GOLD HEART-SHAPED PENDANT, he picks it out. Studies it with intimate surprise.
-..-you kept it. They linger in regretful eyes.
Of course I did.. It’s beautiful.
I never got to give it to you properly..
(solemn) Peter... the way we left it in New York--
(cuts her off) --Glo. You need to rest... And I need to call your family in
--No! Peter looks taken back.
They’1l1 only worry, and gossip.. and anyway I’m gonna be fine! Seriously! So don’t bother anyone.
Y’sure?
Yeah. She’s adamant, Peter shrugs.. Her call. Then his attention drawn to her BLACK SUEDE STILETTOS.. he unpacks them from the case.
I bought these with you on Bond Street, remember?
They’re my ‘Ruby Red Slippers’. (pause) Primrose Hill. We had fun right?
Lots of it. Suddenly Gloria’s breathing seizes up; she gulps and swallows hard.
Burp me Peter.. please... Peter rubs her back ‘till she gradually gets her breath back.
I’1l get you some water.
Milk please baby, y’know I love milk. Peter nods, rises. FOLLOW him out, and in ONE SHOT--
INT. PRIMROSE-HILL HALLWAY/GLORIA’S ROOM - DAY 16 Peter walking down a tatty hallway, paint peeling, discarded mail on the floor. CAPTION: PRIMROSE HILL, LONDON - 1979.  16 14.

‘Loo Poo Boo Moo Lah Pah Bah Mah’. Intrigued by ‘actor-ish’ noises he creeps to the door from which it emanates.. reveal it’s slightly ajar. PETER’S POV: Gloria, 56 but stealing late 30's; subtly glamorous in 501’s, cropped T-shirt, peering in a full length mirror doing vocal/facial warm-ups.
“No, said he. Away, said she. ‘A’ sitting very prettily by a chestnut tree." Peter smiles.. somewhat smitten.
‘Fluffy floppy puppy--
My new tenant’s arrived. Peter spins round guiltily to see DIDI THE LANDLADY down the corridor relishing her third gin of the day.
‘Sally Saw Silvestre Stacking Saucers Side by Side.’ Peter and Didi listen and titter.
Like ‘My Fair bleeding Lady’.
I know what she’s doing.. vocal exercises. Who is she?
She’s an actress. Famous one too... Or was.
What’s she called?
‘Gloria Grahame’. Always played the tart.
Doesn't ring a bell.  16 17 15.
Big name in black and white films. Not doing too well in colour though.. obviously.
Makes you say that?
Well, she ‘aint swanning about Sunset Boulevard now is she Peter luv? No, she’s renting a room in my house talking bloody nonsense.
‘Paul pruned Penelope's pansies leaving poor Penelope perplexed’. Peter, intrigued by Didi’s insight...
(shrugs ) Dunno Didi. She sounds pretty colourful to me. They smile as he heads back to his NEXT DOOR ROOM.
Peter checking his mail box, spots Gloria stood at her door watching him, smoking, dark glasses. Sultry.
Next door guy, right?
(nods ) Which makes you ‘the girl next door’. They check each other out - a buzz between them.
Hey, you seen the movie ‘Saturday Night Fever’?
Three times. 16 17  17 18 19 16.
You like disco dancing?
I like drunk dancing.
So if I fix you a drink will you come in my room and hustle with me? I need a partner for my dance class.
Fix me a drink and I'll clean your bathroom too. Gloria laughs, disappears inside. Peter shrugs - what the hell - follows her in.

Establisher of the house. ‘More Than A Woman’ by the Bee Gees from ‘SNF’ drifts over the street. INT. GLORIA’S PRIMROSE ROOMS - CONTINUOUS Gloria leads Peter in complicated dance moves. Peter not quite in step, getting a sweat-on. Gloria coyly stripped to her strap top. She barks out moves to which Peter sweetly obeys.
We got some moves goin’ on here!
They miscast Travolta. (Tony Manero/Travolta) “Would ya just watch the hair!"
It’s him!
I got a better bum... The music/dancing stops. She looks him up and down. 17 18 19  19 17.
I noticed. (pause) You’re an actor too right?
I pretend to be.
What you working on?
Tables, chairs, sideboards..
Huh?
I work in a second hand furniture shop right now. In between acting jobs I’m afraid.
Don’t be afraid, honey. We’ve all been there. There’s heat between them. And they know it.
Let me fix you another drink? I got some nice bourbon.. Peter checks his watch.
I promised a friend I’d go to the theatre.
A ‘Him’ or a ‘Her’ friend.
A ‘Him’.
(small smile) What you going to see?
‘Krapps Last Tape’ by Samuel Becket.  18.
I hope it’s better then it sounds.
It’s a one man play.
I love those things.
Why?
You get to say all the lines. They both smile. Gloria fixes herself a drink.
Well.. pop in anytime. We can talk about ‘the craft’? Swap notes and stuff.
And more disco?
You bet! Hold on their obvious attraction.
Really nice to meet you Gloria.

And you Peter.. Peter leaves. As soon as the door shuts Gloria CLUCKS THE ROOF OF HER MOUTH. 20 INT. PUB THEATRE —- LATER 20 PATRONS OF THE ARTS watch THE ONE MAN performing. Peter at the back with DAN (late 20’s) - trendy Bryan Ferry haircut. They talk in whispers..
You're sure it’s actually her?
Well, she’s called Gloria. She’s American.. she looks film actress-y..  19.
and she says she splits her time between a place in LA and her Manhattan apartment... All sounds pretty ‘Hollywood’ to me.
Don’t believe it... all a ruse. *
For what?
To lure young naive, northern men into a deviant web of mental manipulation and sexual depravity.
(pause) Sounds good. DAN sneaks an arm round Peter’s shoulder.
(semi-joky) But what about us darling?
(sarcy) * What about ‘us’? * Peter warmly clasps his hand. *
‘Us’ are just fine and dandy * Daniel. * Rubs it affectionately. But in his eyes we see a tiny * seed of doubt. *
Nice and wide as Peter walks into his digs..
Peter enters, puts his key in his door WHEN HE HEARS--
(screech)
Peter rushes to Gloria’s door. BANGS ON. Nothing. He turns the handle, it opens slightly - then gets rammed shut from the inside.
Oh no you don’t!
It’s Peter! Are you ok?
No!
Is it serious?!
Yes!
Shall I call 999?
(pause) Do they have spare shirts?
Y’what?
(pause) I’m dying my eyelashes and I’ve spilt the goddamn stuff all over my shirt. Gloria opens the door slightly, we can tell she’s shirtless (bra on) - her eyes meet Peter’s.
Hey Peter you couldn’t help me out, My other shirt is in the laundry..
You only have two shirts?
How many do you have?
More than two.
So I can borrow one right?  22 23 21.
JUMP CUT TO - Peter approaching Gloria’s door fresh shirt in hand when he hears:

‘La Poo Boo Moo..' He leaves his shirt on her door handle. INT. GLORIA’S PRIMROSE ROOMS - NIGHT 23 Gloria left her door ajar accidently on purpose. Peter wanders up clutching a bottle of wine and a HAND-WRITTEN NOTE - stops to enjoy his voyeur opportunity. POV: Gloria dressed in Peter’s shirt, rehearsing lines, (Clemence Dane’s adaptation of ‘Rain’). She paces around, throwing looks into the full length mirror getting into character as Sadie Thompson.

“How do you know what I've suffered! Your God and my God could never be shipmates"”. Gloria stands staring at herself, passionate as Sadie. Then breaks out, paces around, mutters lines to herself - different variations.
(variation) “How do you know what I've suffered?" Steps closer.

(softer) “You tell him Sadie Thompson is on her way to hell.” She plays with her range/her emotions. Then drops all pretence - steps right up to the mirror so her nose is touching... looks through herself. Peter finally knocks on. She raises an eyebrow.
(Shakespearean) “Hark, how they knock..” As if she knew Peter was there all along. She walks over and gently pulls the door open all the way.  23 24 22.
(coquettish) Peter..
Hope I’m not disturbing.
Hell no. I love it when strange men come knocking on my door with bottles booze.
Er.. I got your note. It was on my bed. He shows her the NOTE.
(reading it) “Hey Peter, don’t forget to call in---”

Sshh.. Don’t ruin it for me. She stands aside to let him in. Peter passes the wine. The door shuts us out. INT. GLORIA’S PRIMROSE ROOMS —- MOMENTS LATER Gloria hands a glass of wine to Peter, she carries on with a GLASS OF MILK.
Liverpoooool. I just wanna go to Liverpoooool. That’s how you pronounce it right? Say it again.
Liverpool.
Liverpooool.. Love it. ‘The Fab Four’, right?!
(smiles) Yeah..
You remind me of Lennon. 23 24
Really?
Yeah, you got the nose and the attitude.
I do?

Ahu.. I see him sometimes walking in Central Park with that crazy beautiful chic of his, they look so cool. They look goood on each other know what I mean? Some couples just look right. They eye each other up CLOSELY; both know she’s meaning THEY would look good together too.
You gotta take me there someday, Liverpooool. Peter giggling like a kid.
(playful) Peter you’re laughing at me you meanie. Peter sits on the sofa - fidgety. He notices a copy of ‘Being and Nothingness’ by Jean Paul Sartre on the arm of the sofa - he flicks through.
“Better to die on one's feet than to live on one's knees”. Gloria looks up - impressed.
Try telling Hollywood that. Gloria hands him his glass - sits at the other end of the sofa so she can get a good look at him. Peter notices she’s sill wearing his shirt.
It suits you..  24.
I love wearing men’s clothes.
And I look great in women’s... On Tuesdays Peter becomes ‘Petra’.
(laughs ) Well if Petra wants to borrow from my closet just let me know.
I'll pass it on. Cheers.
Cheers. They drink... Gloria lets the air sit. Peter picks up her stage-play lying on the coffee table - checks the front cover out. POV: ‘RAIN’.
(flicking through) What’s it about?
(eyes him) Sex.. Sin... Salvation.
Sounds heavy...
Just another day at the Gloria Grahame office honey. Peter can’t suppress a giggle.
What’s so funny? Peter keeps giggling.
I love the way you say stuff!
Touché Sexual jousting.  24 25 26 25.
CLOSE on Gloria’s GLASS OF MILK as she rests it on a nearby side table--

INT. BELLA’S GUEST ROOM - NIGHT THE GLASS OF MILK Peter has brought for Gloria (end of sc. 18). He rests it on the bedside table. Gloria laid back, eyes closes. He thinks she’s asleep, when she pipes up:
Thanks honey..
You need anything else?
My mirror honey, my Bogie compact... Peter picks up the compact from the bedside table. Passes it to Gloria, flips it open and on her reflection we--
The reflection of GLORIA’S LIPS in the compact--
Is my lipstick on right? I was in a rush. Reveal they are in line to see the movie ‘ALIEN’.
Perfectly right. (pause) How’s mine? She laughs squeezes his hand in hers. CINEMA GO-ERS cast furtive glances - recognising her or deliberating whether it’s her or not.
So is this like a date? 24 25
I thought you could do with a break from rehearsals.
You're so kind.
Plus you were sending me mad with all the ‘pooh bah mah’ shite.
Honesty. I like that in a fellah.
(noticing the glances) People are looking at you.
How do you know it’s not you?

I’m guessing you’re more interesting to look at than me. Gloria notices the attention now.. INT. CINEMA —- LATER ON THE BIG SCREEN: John Hurt complains about the menu when his stomach starts rumbling.... CUT TO - the AUDIENCE, eyes growing wider. Peter slinking further down in his seat, GLORIA casually popping popcorn. John Hurt’s stomach bursts open! Peter buries his eyes in Gloria’s arm - who is more in awe at the special effects (so different to her day).
Jeez. Look at those guts everywhere.. ‘aint that something... She sweetly strokes Peter’s head.
You okay down there sweetie? 26 27  27. 28 INT. PUB - LATER —- NIGHT 28 Gloria and Peter burst in with that ‘just-seen-a- great-movie’ energy. Head to the bar.
It’s when the small aliens pop out from between your legs that things get complicated... The BARMAN comes over - peering at Gloria. Peter orders two pints.
How many times has that happened to you then?
Oh just the four..
Four!? Gloria not sure how to take this. Peter genuinely flabbergasted.
What? You didn’t think I’d have any kids?
I didn’t expect you to have four, that’s like--
-One more than three.
Where are they?
I keep ‘em safe.. with my four ex-husbands. Peter has to catch his jaw.
Excuse me, I need to powder my nose. Gloria heads off unsure how she’s come out of that; BARMAN arrives with the pints of ale.  28.
Two fifty mate. Peter breaks out of his spell, pays up.
Don’t mean to pry, but is that Gloria ‘whatsername’... Grahame.
I’m not 100 percent. She says she is.
I recognise that pout! She was in loads of things in the 50's, a proper film star she was.
Apparently so, yeah..
Won an Oscar too if my memory serves me right.
Y’what?
Yeah, that film she did with Kirk Douglas, forget the name.
An Oscar? You sure? This hits Peter just as hard as ‘the kids’ reveal.
She not mentioned it?
(reflective) No...
If I’d won an Oscar I'd be wearing it round my neck so every Tom Dick and Harry’d would get the message. Knowhat- I-mean son?  29.
Sat opposite. Peter eyeing Gloria with intrigue. The Oscar revelation knocked him off balance. Gloria catches him....
What?
What, what?
You that’s what... Peter innocently points at himself.
Yeah, you mister. You’ve gone all quiet on me.
I’m just ‘The strong, silent type’.
Oh yeah?
Think Robert Redford y’know.. ‘The Sundance Kid’.
OK I’m thinking... and I like that thought. They hold each others eyes... enjoying the sights.

head_text.subj: AND AS THE TUBE LIGHTS FLICKER ON AND OFF WE--

text: 30 INT. GLORIA’S PRIMROSE ROOMS - LATER - NIGHT 30 Gloria hands a large glass of bourbon to Peter.
Cheers. They clink glasses and drink.  30 30.
This is becoming a habit.
I like habits. Especially bad ones. She clucks her mouth.
Hey, I gotta question. How do you join the Royal Shakespeare Company?
You don’t just fill a form out. I think you get invited to apply.
How do you get invited?
Through your agent. Or they head-hunt you I imagine. I mean I don’t know for sure, I wish I did.
OK, I’1l let my agent know...
Why?
‘Coz I really wanna play Juliet for the ‘RSC’.
Juliet??
Yeah.
(laughs ) You mean the Nurse don’t you?! Gloria... a slow rage begins to engulf her.
I get it. You think I’m too old to play Juliet huh?
Peter straightens - doesn’t know what to say.
(in his face) Huh??? Gloria’s eyes blaze through him.
Fine! She slams her drink down, marches to the coat stand.
Fine! Puts on her rain-coat.
You think I’m just an old lady don’tcha? Too old for you is that what you’re saying?
Er.. That’s not what I said. Gloria - too wrapped up in her rage.

Well you’re wrong Mister! I’m gonna go to that theatre right now and see one of their shows. Take a look at the competition. Thanks. Thanks a bunch! At least I have a chance to join the ‘RS’ goddamn ‘C’ coz at least I’m an actor who works! Peter jumps in front of the door.
Come on, don’t be like this..
Move.
I’m not sure the RSC even has a performance tonight.
‘The Merchant of Venice’. Aldwych Theatre. 7.30. I’ve done my homework!  32.
Well I don’t want you to go!
Why?
Because-— And with no words left in his locker Peter just grabs hold of Gloria and plants his lips on her. AN intense and long kiss - finally they come up for air.

There! That’s why! A moment where Gloria feels the dizzy after effects. Then BAM! Peter grabs her - lips meet - the pent up frustrations. They smother each other. Clothes hit the floor - Peter hoists her up, Gloria’s legs straddle him, and he marches her into the bedroom. (TRANSITION STEADI-CAM SHOT)

head_text.subj: AS HE CARRIES HER, LIPS LOCKED, TOWARDS THE BED
AROUND THEM AND AS THE CAMERA MOVES BEHIND PETER WE..

text: STILL ROTATING... come round on Peter - now find him sat, gazing with DEEP CONCERN at a SLEEPING GLORIA... the camera keeps going... moves behind Peter, AND WE...
32 INT. WATFORD THEATRE — NIGHT 32 Come off PETER’s BACK to discover HIM consuming a VIBRANT Gloria play Sadie Thompson on OPENING NIGHT.
"You tell him Sadie Thompson is on her way to hell!!"

A PACKED THEATRE glued to Gloria's performance.  33 34 33. INT. WATFORD THEATRE — CONTINUOUS 33 THE HUGE APPLAUSE continues as Gloria takes her curtain call. She plays it like the Hollywood pro she is. Peter is on his feet, wolf whistling. Gloria throws him a personal cross-eyed wink which he loves!
Buzzy 1st night party. Gloria and Peter in the midst quaffing champagne, LOTS OF ADMIRERS and people wanting to shake her hand.
Thank you.. Thanks. Thank you so much... The producer GEORGE bustles over, takes her in his arms. They luvvie kiss. Peter notes he squeezes Gloria’s waist tighter than is appropriate..
Superlatives are redundant darling.
Oh Georgie, you got me going all red. Gloria adept to a director’s praise. Enjoys it.
Georgie... this is my good friend Peter. (to Peter) Georgie produced this gig. George gives Peter the once over, doesn't shake his hand.
Yeah Hi. (back to Gloria) There’s an exquisite brasserie in Soho. We could stay up, wait for the rave reviews?

What? Y’need me to make your mind up for you now?
I’m just worried, things haven’t been right for a few weeks now--
You know what-- You wanna leave me? Fine, leave me. People walk out on me all the time honey.
Glo, I don’t think--
Hey, I got an idea! (beat) Go! Now! Right fucking now! GLORIA FLIPS; grabs his case from the top of the wardrobe, flings it on the bed, PILES HIS CLOTHES IN.
You're packing me up?? Peter laughs incredulously
The suitcase? Come on!!
Yeah, it’s fucking ‘suitcase time’ for you buster. Glo keeps packing him up..
You're nuts y’know that! This is absolutely off it’s head! She launches the case into the hallway.
Go to hell Peter! She slams the bedroom door. Locks it from the inside.
You really want me to leave?
Yeah, send me a postcard to tell me you got home safe, OK?
Can’t we at least talk? Glo...?

Gloria back against the wall hyperventilating with despair. The hardest thing she’s EVER had to do. INT. GLORIA’S BEDROOM/MANHATTAN APARTMENT - MORNING Gloria asleep in her clothes. The phone rings waking her.. she picks it up and drops it down. Then from outside the door.
Gloria? Gloria are you awake? Gloria stays silently still... but hating herself. Peter sounds lost and teary.

This isn’t fair.. I don’t get it.. (pause) Actually... maybe I do.... Yeah I do... OK... (pause) Bye Gloria... We hear the suitcase being dragged out - and the front door opening and banging shut. Gloria closes her eyes... and drifts off to sleep again.

INT. GLORIA’S BEDROOM/MANHATTAN APARTMENT - NIGHT She opens them... still in her clothes, night. She listens for signs of Peter-life outside her door.. INT. GLORIA’S MANHATTAN APARTMENT —- MOMENTS LATER —
The bedroom door unlocks; Gloria enters an apartment void of Peter. Know’s he’s gone. Feels his lack.. 94 95 96 97  97

She wanders over and sits at her dressing table, looks in the mirror. Then she spots something on the table. THE HEART SHAPED PENDANT - a present from Peter. She picks it up.. her eye-lids heavy with lost love.. looks in the mirror. Reflection shot: LAUREL GRAY from ‘In a Lonely Place’.
“I lived a few weeks whilst you loved me - goodbye Dix." MOVE IN ON THE LOVE HEART PENDANT as she fixes it AROUND HER NECK, and we--
INT. STAIRS/BELLA’S KITCHEN - DAWN Back with Gloria CARESSING THE PENDANT as she makes her way downstairs - listening to the argument.
Dry-your eyes lad. She didn’t get in the bleedin’ ambulance!
(pause) They couldn’t get her in Peter. She refused to get in.
But they said it! The ambulance blokes. They told us! She’s dying! She needs to be in hozzie. She can't stay upstairs.
Why not?! Why can’t she?! What if that was your Jessie up there?
Are. You. Fucking. DEAF! Gloria is dying in OUR Mother’s house! (beat) And I’m not gonna let that happen. Hear me lad?? 97
+ + +e * + ee HH
I love Gloria... but I love me Ma more. And so should fuckin’ you! THEN Gloria appears wraith-like in one of BELLA’S FLOWERY NIGHT-GOWNS. Startles everyone!
Hey guys.... I can hear you.. (pause) Look at me! I’m OK... Yeah, I’m sick, but I ‘aint gonna die! Joe honey, I ‘aint gonna die. BEAT.

Oh Gloria, love. Peter! Peter rushes to Gloria’s side.. leads her away. INT. BELLA GUEST ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER 97B Peter settles Gloria back into bed; notes a bottle of DETTOL and cleaning bowl. Opens the window...
I missed you tonight, Peter..
I’m sorry. I just felt-- I dunno Glo... I’m so sorry..
(beat) I need my make-up bag Peter. GLORIA looks into the dressing table mirror--
I like the new nightgown.. REFECTION: VIOLET from ‘IT'S A WONDERFUL LIFE’.

“This old thing? Why I only wear it when I don't care how I look." THEY SMILE AT HER MOST FAMOUS LINE OF DIALOGUE. PETER turns to find her bag.. but when he turns back, he notices her eyes are closed again.
Thinking she’s asleep, he creeps out of the room. SUDDENLY she starts coughing.
Am I fighting for my life Peter? Tell me I’m not fighting for my life? Peter agonising.... he sits in and rubs her back.
You’re gonna be just fine Gloria. I’m sure of it.. GLORIA and PETER remain in each other arms.

Pull back from the PENDANT on a sleeping Gloria.. A weary looking Peter (IN DIFFERENT CLOTHES) notes her erratic breathing. He turns quietly, leaves the room. INT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE/HALLWAY - MOMENTS LATER 99 Peter picks up the phone; dials the operator.
United States, California... (reads address book) 6548790, thank you. The line rings out. Then finaly:
Hello?
Hi! Tim. It’s Peter.. Peter Turner.
Mom’s old friend?
Yeah. Hi... Listen Tim, Gloria’s in Liverpool.. with me... She’s not well Tim.. Drift from Peter having to be dishonest to Gloria, to being deadly honest with Tim.
Peter finds Bella fixing Gloria’s hair again at the dressing table. Mothering her.
(sees him) We’ve decided Bella can be my Mom too. Peter manages a smile.
Ma, can you help dress Gloria into something warm please.
Why?
We’re going out.
Out? Out Where?
It’s a surprise..
Don’t be daft, it’s cold out. She needs to stay here where it’s warm.
Come on Ma.. Just a couple of hours.
(thinks ) No. It’s a stupid idea.
Mum-—
-That’s final. Peter searches for Gloria’s eyes. They connect. Gloria senses FUN.
Bella..
Yes my luv..
I kinda like surprises..
(beat) Are you sure? (pause) Looks like rain out there.
(smiles at Peter) Yeah.. Why not?
(admits defeat) I’ve got some spare thermals somewhere.. Bella exits to sort. Peter smiling at Gloria.
Peter helps a WRAPPED-UP GLORIA out of a taxi; they take in the impressive Victorian frontage.
Oh my! Isn’t she a beauty! They head in.
BOTH ON THE STAGE looking out onto the EMPTY SEATS. Even this sends shivers down their spines.
They've been treading these boards since 1886.
Gee.. That’s some treading.
OLD JACK wanders on with two chairs and a couple of scripts. Plonks the chairs down facing each other, lays the scripts down - and wanders off.
Nice one Jack. Peter helps Gloria over to a chair.
What are you up to?
I thought we’d have some fun.. Peter sits her down, gives her a script. POV: ‘ROMEO AND JULIET’.
You gotta be kidding me??
The Bard’s ‘the nuts’ huh.. (sits opposite) I thought we’d try it out. Page 58. Act 1 scene 5. You there? Peter means it. Gloria finds the page.
I’m there..
Shall we?
Lets.
You first.
Good pilgrim, you do wrong your hand too much, Which mannerly devotion shows in this; For saints have hands that pilgrims' hands do touch, And palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss.
Have not saints lips, and holy palmers too?
Ay, pilgrim, lips that they must use in prayer.  102 103 107.

O, then, dear saint, let lips do what hands do; They pray, grant thou, lest faith turn to despair. For a moment Gloria struggles - the words stick in her throat. Peter unsure what to do - whether to go over - call it a day.. But then--
Saints do not move, though grant for prayers' sake. Peter smiles with pride at his ‘gal’.
Then move not, while my prayer's effect I take. Thus from my lips, by yours, my sin is purged.
Then have my lips the sin that they have took.
Sin from thy lips? O trespass sweetly urged! Give me my sin again.
You kiss by the book. PETER rises.. APPROACHES SLOWLY and kisses her softly on the lips.

I certainly do. A RIPPLE OF APPLAUSE from the wings where a few Stage- Hands, Old Jack, The Surgeon and The Anaesthetist have congregated without them knowing. Peter bows then helps his LEADING LADY up to curtsy. They both look out to an IMAGINARY FULL HOUSE.. and soak up their standing ovation.
Gloria sat in Peter’s arms watching Liverpool’s historic waterfront glide by. His head next to hers protecting her from the wind.
Pointing out certain landmarks. He kisses her head lovingly. Gloria smiles through her exhaustion.
Peter helping Gloria back to bed - she is asleep before she hits the pillow. Peter tucks her in tight, the sadness returned.
Peter taking his curtain call to RAPTUROUS APPLAUSE - a huge smile on his face. Curtain down, he immediately reclaims himself FROM BEING The Nurse.
Peter arriving home - opens the door. A SUITCASE sits in the hallway. An American accent emanates from the kitchen...
Peter finds his family gathered with TIM (28) who stands up, offers his hand, he’s good looking, same age-ish as Peter.. taller maybe.
Tim. Hi.. we finally meet. Wish it wasn’t this way.
Pete.. Thanks for all you've done for Mom. They manage a smile under the circumstances.
(to Bella) How’s she been tonight?
She’s gotten worse.
I asked your mother to call the doctor.  109.
Peter tries to contain himself.
That’s only gonna stress her out.
I needed an official note that would allow Mom to travel.
Travel? Travel where?
There’s a doctor at St. Vincent's New York who Mum trusts. I’ve persuaded her to let him examine her.
New York!?
It’s our only chance Peter!
She can’t get on a plane! The journey will kill her.
What’s the alternative?
She goes to hospital.. here. ‘The Liverpool Royal’.
You've said yourself.. she hates doctors.
Then she stays where she is!
Here? In your Mom’s house?
Yes! She’s comfortable. She’s got me. And my Ma! (to Bella and Joe) Us!  110.
Peter. With all due respect... you're just an ex-boyfriend. This hits Peter hard. THEN SUDDENLY AND SURPRISINGLY--
Peter. (pause) Tim's here. And he’s Gloria’s son. (to Tim) And if that’s your decision Tim... (eyeballs Peter) Everyone in this family will support you. Tim nods in appreciation.
Wrong move. I’m saying now..
Lad. It’s not up to you. PETER EYE-BALLS EVERYONE.
So.. we need to be on the 6.20 flight to Heathrow tomorrow morning, then on to JFK. We need to be leaving here at 4am.
(beat) I’ll get the taxi. I gotta pal that works that time..
Thank you. (looks around) All of you... For everything. (pause) Please can I use the phone upstairs for final arrangements? Joe Snr nods. Tim leaves. The family sit in silence.
(to Peter) It’s for the best lad.
Joe Snr leaves; just Bella and Peter in the kitchen.
I’1l make some tea. Peter slowly takes a seat.
Tim looking down on Gloria. Peter enters.
I have to try Peter. I gotta try and save Mom. (pause) I’m just glad she had you to call on. Peter nods solemnly.
It’s a long journey tomorrow. Let me stay with her tonight.
She’s my responsibility now..

Tim! (pause) She’s still my girlfriend... (fixes him) Please. Tim gets it.. They emotionally hug. Tim leaves, Peter closes the bedroom door. ALONE... sits close to Gloria - her breathing irregular; skin ghostly grey. Suddenly Gloria moans, groans, gasps in her sleep.
It’s OK Glo. I’m here. Don’t fight it. Don’t go on... I’m here now... Let go. A pillow falls to the floor. Peter picks it up - and for a moment there is a flash of the unthinkable.
+ ee HH
+ ee HH

Peter watches on helpless as Gloria’s deteriorates: Peter moistening her cracked lips; Gloria muttering old lines of dialogue; restlessness; crying in her sleep; her breathing now the dreaded ‘DEATH RATTLE’.
A BLACK CAB arrives for it’s 4AM pick-up.
Peter looking at Gloria - sat in exactly the same position. Has been all night. A knock on the door. Bella comes in.
Taxi’s here. Peter doesn’t respond.
Peter?
I heard you Ma.
I’m going to wake Tim. Bella disappears. Peter on a motionless Gloria.
Gloria. No answer.
Gloria... time to go. Gloria's eyes flick open; confusion then she recognises Peter and calms. The overhead light goes on. Bella, Tim, Joe and Joe Snr busy themselves. Tim and Peter help her upright.
Mom I’m going to get you back home. But you have to help me by giving one of your greatest ever performances OK? Is that a deal?  113.
Gloria nods.

We can’t send her out like this! She needs make-up. A flurry of energy as Peter applies make-up, brushes her hair, dresses her in her favourite clean cream silk pyjamas, wraps her in a head scarf, plants thick woolen socks fitted on her ‘fat feet’. A white fox fur placed around her shoulders. He loads her dark sun-glasses on last. Tim and Joe get Gloria on her feet, she takes a step then collapses.
We need to carry her down.

Gloria perched on a wooden chair, carried down the stairs by Peter, Tim and Joe. Like removal men shifting a heavy set of drawers. They manage to get her to the bottom. Joe Snr stops the procession - gives Gloria a kiss.. her eyes thank him. THEN BELLA STEPS FORWARD leans in - embraces Gloria.
May the Lord protect you Gloria Grahame.
Don’t forget..
What my luv?
A son needs his Mom... Billy needs you.

Bella grips her tight, Gloria can’t see her tears.  113 114. EXT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER 113 Gloria loaded into the cab. Peter fixes her seat belt; bends in, kisses her on the lips... trying not to cry.
Peter.. how do I look? Peter laughs through his cry.
Beautiful. (pause) Always beautiful Gloria. Gloria manages her SIGNATURE ‘CLUCK’. THEY KISS AS PASSIONATELY AS POSSIBLE...
Call me when you land.. I’1l be awake. Tim gets in the cab. Peter summons the strength.. and tears himself away from her arms.
I'll be waiting! Right here!
(pause) In Liverpoooool. They somehow share a smile.
CUT TO - the Taxi sets off. It disappears......
hoping it’ll come back.. but it doesn’t.
Eh, knob-head.. Peter snaps to reality. Reveal Joe at the gate. A MOMENT... then Joe walks into the street, takes Peter into his arms; hugs him with all the love he has.  113 114 115.
PETER struggling to KEEP IT IN

I know... I know.. (pause) Come on Lad. He leads Peter back inside the house. BLOOD BROTHERS. INT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE - AT THE SAME TIME - DAWN 114 Bella and Joe Snr sat at the table.. no words. Lost in Gloria thoughts. Joe enters, hovering by the door.
Is he OK?
He’ll be fine, don’t worry. I’1l make sure he’s OK. I’11 make sure for you. Bella smiles. Joe is a ‘Carlsberg’ son... probably the BEST in the world.
Joe..
Yes Ma?

Fetch that big suitcase from the basement... me and your Dad need to pack... for Australia. Joe half smiles, relieved.. obediently heads off. Bella reaches for Joe Snr’s hand, he readily clasps it. Life goes on.. and life is Australia, Billy and...

Peter enters. Breathes in HER presence. Sits on the bed, it’s still warm.. He’s beyond crying, beyond heart break. Then he spots something by his feet. POV: PUBLICITY POSTCARD OF GLORIA FROM ‘THE BAD AND THE BEAUTIFUL’
It must have dropped from her suitcase in the melee. Peter picks it up... and it’s true--- GLORIA GRAHAME IS TRULY BEAUTIFUL. FOREVER.

Deserted. The TAXI driving at funeral pace, couriering precious cargo. Gloria somehow shines in the dull overhead cab-light, dressed in cream silk, film-star shades, head scarf, a white fox fur on her shoulders.. ..a tragic goddess from the ‘Silver Screen’.

head_text.subj: GLORIA ARRIVED IN NEW YORK AND WAS ADMITTED TO ST.

text: VINCENT’S HOSPITAL
“The winner.... Gloria Grahame for ‘The Bad and the Beautiful!'" APPLAUSE from a star-studded crowd.
INT. ‘RKO THEATRE’ /HOLLYWOOD - REAL FOOTAGE 117
GLORIA sashays (not entirely gracefully) to the stage. Dress off the peg, hair brushed not styled. Smile fixed. She shakes EDMUND’s hand. Dazed.. as the FAMOUS STATUETTE is placed in her palm.
Finds HER AUDIENCE with a subtle, Gloria grin.
(verbatim) “Thank you... Thank you all very much.” Gloria Grahame exits stage left.
